page.title: 01GENERAL INFORMATION
page.content: Walesby is a rural village on the B6387 two miles from Ollerton and six miles from Retford. Kirton is a much smaller village standing on the A6075 two miles out of Ollerton on the Tuxford road. The two villages are joined by a narrow, winding minor road. The name Walesby is Scandinavian in derivation meaning "Val's village and Kirton is Anglo-Saxon meaning "Church Farm. Both villages are on the eastern edge of the North Nottinghamshire coalfield close to Sherwood Forest and the large estates of Thoresby and Clumber. The area within the block is mainly rural with a number of small wooded areas. The county constituency boundary also runs through the northern part of the area, separating the Newark and Bassetlaw districts.
